text: Hey all! Just deep diving into a page that is currently ranking #7 (according to Ahrefs) with 177 backlinks going to it. Everything ranking between 1-6 for this search have between 1200 and 6000 backlinks. Currently my plan is to review the content and see if we can optimize things like internal links and adding images, and hopefully pull up a little higher, I'll also continue to build links to it, but realistically I'm not getting 1000 links for this one page. Any other suggestions to try to bump it into the top 5? :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: Hey all! Just deep diving into a page that is currently ranking #7 (according to Ahrefs) with 177 backlinks going to it. Everything ranking between 1-6 for this search have between 1200 and 6000 backlinks. Currently my plan is to review the content and see if we can optimize things like internal links and adding images, and hopefully pull up a little higher, I'll also continue to build links to it, but realistically I'm not getting 1000 links for this one page. Any other suggestions to try to bump it into the top 5?

text:
• Rewrite the titles to more closely match what's ranking higher
• Write a half dozen supporting articles around this content and link them into it.
• Do a video that's basically a recap of the content and embed it on the page and then also link to the article from the YouTube post description
• Build more backlinks

text: Hi Carla, my suggestion is to look at referring domains instead of backlinks. You'll likely find that the delta between you and your competitors is a lot smaller and manageable. I think this is also a good use case for using a tool like SurferSEO or Frase. I personally have used SurferSEO and it's worked well for me.  Another thing I would try is adding something to the title tag to make it more clickable because all else equal a page with a higher CTR will rank higher in my experience. Lastly, if feel like your content is much better than all the rest of the pages ranking above you and actually deserves to be #1, then it might just need more time to rank higher. For example, I've seen a page take a year to settle into ranking #1 for it's target keyword (did nothing but the initial optimizations and create an article that was much better than the rest of the pages ranking) but take that with a grain of salt as it was a low DA site and in a competitive niche.

text: Hey Nathanial. Thanks for that! we have Surfer SEO and I definitely like the way it helps me ensure better heading titles, I will see when the last time we ran the page through the platform was, maybe it's time for a re-up. Great point about referring domains too, I think there's probably some targets we can approach there for links too.

elements.text: Hey Nathanial. Thanks for that! we have Surfer SEO and I definitely like the way it helps me ensure better heading titles, I will see when the last time we ran the page through the platform was, maybe it's time for a re-up. text: Happy to help! Also one last thing on SurferSEO. Alot of people will just take the recommendations it spits out but that's not the best approach. A  better way is to carefully select the competitors it's basing the recommendations off of. In your case, I would only select the ones ranking above yours. You'll see the tool will spit out different recommendations when you do it this way. It's never steered me wrong :)

text: I know enough SEO to be dangerous. Kidding! But I do primarily use SEO for optimizing blog posts as a writer. That's my wheelhouse. I would love to learn more beyond just SEO content writing, though. Any tips for me as I branch out?

text:
Next you can learn content strategy e.g keyword research skills, user intent, painpoints, content prioritization etc

Then you’ll need to have at least some basics for acquiring backlinks. Because content by itself won’t take you too far especially in competitive markets.

I highly recommend some good content marketing courses. It’s the best way to level up in this area.

text: Consuming everything on <https://ahrefs.com/academy|Ahrefs’ Academy> is a great place to start.

attachments.fallback: Ahrefs Academy: Learn how to apply Ahrefs' tools & data in your Digital Marketing
attachments.text: Video tutorials that teach you how to rank higher in search engines. Learn basics from keyword research to on-page SEO, plus dig into topics like blogging for businesses and how to use Ahrefs.
attachments.title: Ahrefs Academy: Learn how to apply Ahrefs' tools & data in your Digital Marketing

elements.text: Consuming everything on
Ahrefs’ Academy
is a great place to start.

text: MarketMuse!

elements.text: MarketMuse!

text: Look at what those other pages cover, and make your page better than theirs. Google wants to serve up the best page possible in Position #1. A tool like MarketMuse will help you easily see the keywords and topics that the competitor pieces include. (Or you could pull and compile Ahrefs spreadsheets with all of the topics each of those competitor pages ranks for, and look for commonly occurring words/phrases and the frequency at which they appear.)
